result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremiah K Pettigrue was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at a rate of $50.00 per month commencing 7/01/2016; alternate 31 days jail. Payment plan fee of $15.00 to be imposed as well.
DNA paid along with fine on payment plan.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremiah K Pettigrue

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Jeremiah K Pettigrue in court with Attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Stare gives sentencing recommendation.  Attorney Perkins makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  FINE:  $1,355.50 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid at $50.00 per month, commencing 7/1/16, alternate 31 days jail if not paid) 

**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.**

Attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins in court.   Defendant Jeremiah K Pettigrue did not appear.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Perkins does not know why her client is not here. State requests capias.   Court ordered a capias stayed until next court date.  Hearing scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jeremiah K Pettigrue in court with attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins.  Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests more time to speak with client.  Hearing scheduled for May 9, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jeremiah K Pettigrue in court with attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel has just received Discovery and needs time to go over with her client. Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for April 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeremiah K Pettigrue in court.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant stated that he didn't have time to go to the public defender's. Court adjourns the matter for him to go to the public defender's office.  Hearing scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Defendant Jeremiah K Pettigrue in court, in custody.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kelsey Morin appears as friend of the court.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
Defendant Jeremiah K Pettigrue not in court.  Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
